nodes.bodyText: Maybe you could test the other way round, and return Number as default, i.e. if (mode == ChangeMode.REMOVE_ALL ...)
Same issue here.
Wrong event class xD
Number of bookshelves where exactly? Near the enchantment table? How near, exactly? You can link to Minecraft wiki if it depends on MC version or is too complex to explain with a few sentences.
Is there any replacement in later versions? Also, use separate annotation to spell out the requirements.
There is functionality for this in later versions. It is more advanced though.
Indicate required MC version in annotation meant for requirements.
Requirements annotation.
Nullable annotation to line before.
Change visual to e.g. cosmetic.
Requirements annotation.
No inline nullable annotation.

We often get people asking for help, who demand examples from us (on discord).
I recommend adding a bit more of an example here, one which could include an event.
I’ll make the changes soon! Thanks for the reply :)
should a dash really be an option and should [ed] be optional? enchanted-item is kinda ugly and so is enchant-item. don't think anyone would really try that rather than just having a space

skript already has a click type expression - it makes more sense to add support for enchant events to that rather than make a whole new expression

  
    
      Skript/src/main/java/ch/njol/skript/expressions/ExprClicked.java
    
    
         Line 201
      in
      4947bb8
    
    
    
    

        
          
           return new ClickType[] {((InventoryClickEvent) e).getClick()};

To me, "if the click type is 1" is less clear than "if the clicked enchantment button is 1", but maybe I'm misunderstanding what you mean. Perhaps it would be better to add "clicked enchantment button" to ExprClicked.
put toArray on it's own line please
maybe it makes sense to add a Map.Entry<Enchantment, Integer> constructor to EnchantmentType the bukkit API usually returns enchants as a map like this
what about enchantment cost? also usually xp is valid too
or cost of the enchantment

in my opinion, this expression should not support that singular syntax - you should simply have enchantment offers then another expression can handle things like first element out of enchantment offer

I think it'd be nice to be able to write
enchantment level of enchantment offer 1
than
enchantment level of first element out of enchantment offers

alright, but to be consistent with other expressions the pattern should be 1st enchantment offer and the number should be an expression otherwise you can't do enchantment offer {_something}

wouldn't it be offerNumber != 3?
if I try to set it to 0 or a negative number should it really set the level to 1?
if the change is less than 1 why does it change anything at all?
getPropertyName isn't meant to have the syntax tokens in it, it is used for the toString and should be representative of how it would read in a script
getPropertyName isn't meant to have the syntax tokens in it, it is used for the toString and should be representative of how it would read in a script
getPropertyName isn't meant to have the syntax tokens in it, it is used for the toString and should be representative of how it would read in a script
doesn't give the right output when the enchantment offers expression is used
subtracting 0 shouldn't subtract 1, it should just do nothing
that implies this will match anything without whitespace which is not true - toVariableNameString has a space in it
no need to add these other types

no need to duplicate the code:
return toString(eo, 0);
should be enchanted item
missing spaces around <
you don't have to check if it contains the key or value, you can just remove
remove all is not the same as delete, it requires an expression. for example remove all sharpness 1 from applied enchants would remove all enchants in this case
what do you mean when you say it doesn't serve a purpose?
this example is incorrect
why the hardcoded 2? you should still use the length of the array

i think it would make more sense to add an enchantment event value to the event and just piggy back off the cost property expression that already exists. it would allow for the same syntax is less code

So, this expression is actually the cost that was displayed on the side of the enchantment offer. From what I saw in testing, it doesn't actually do anything if you modify it (I'll test again though), so I'm not why it's even modifiable in the first place. However, since the code is pretty much already there, maybe someone will find a use for being able to modify it. I'll clean up the  code & docs on this one.
instead of a whole expression for this, couldn't you just have this just return an EnchantmentOffer and use the already existing cost expression
Since EnchantmentOffer wasn't added until 1.11, this expression exists to give users on 1.9 / 1.10 some ability to make changes. The word "offer" in this expression is a little misleading.
maybe you could create skript's own EnchantmentOffer and register that on old versions kind of like how ItemType wraps ItemStack and Color wraps Bukkit's color
That could be interesting, although this is the only customizable part on 1.9 / 1.10 I believe.
exprOfferNumber may be null, this could cause an NPE
new EnchantmentOffer[0];
also wouldn't it make more sense to just check the length of the offer array? just because this is the length now doesn't mean it will be in the future
I will have to change that. There could be 0-3 offers, so I'll have to account for that.
wouldn't this mean you can't do add -1 to player's level to a level 1 player and get 0?
This check is to just make sure the level isn't being set to a number < 1, because you aren't able to do that. However, I will add some comments for clarity.
shouldn't this be reversed? offer.getEnchantmentLevel() - level
shouldn't scripters be able to set the level to 0 or even negative levels if they wanted to?
It does not work - an error is thrown.
even if it's set to 0?
Yep. I thought it was possible to get enchantments of those levels, but maybe not? The cost and enchantment level both have to be greater than 0.
Remove this change

nodes.bodyText: This should be "offer:" + eo.getEnchantment().getKey().getKey() + "=" + eo.getEnchantmentLevel() or something similar, and the varible pattern may match that as well.
This should just be called Enchant Item
This method accepts an array, and it should match the given name parameter on Skript#registerEvent method for the event.
Same as above, remove Enchant Event and make @Events match with the event name.

I believe this should be fine if it takes only EnchantmentType due to the Enchantment -> EnchantmentType converter (and Skript shouldn't really be returning Enchantment anywhere, if it does, it should be changed), not 100% sure though.
Oh right, I wrote that lol. Yeah, we should fix that but for now, just keep accepting both. Sorry for the confusion.
